sn10.11:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
sn10.11:4.3: Now at that time a certain lay follower gave a robe to the nun Cīrā.
sn10.11:4.4: Then a native spirit had so much confidence in Cīrā that he went street to street and square to square, and on that occasion recited these verses:
sn10.11:5.2: That lay-follower is so very wise.
sn10.11:5.3: He gave a robe to Cīrā,
sn10.11:5.4: who is released from all bonds.”
